sentences.sContent: As an added incentive, there’s a bottle of champagne for the best team.
sentences.sCn: 给最优秀的队发一瓶香槟作为额外的鼓励。

sentences.sContent: ...and coal may provide little incentive for research to find even cheaper substitutes for those fuels...
...they have an incentive to keep us hooked...
...And the head-to-head competition might give them a strong incentive to lower their prices...
...Fair competition might create a strong incentive for insurers to charge less...
...these experiments rely on incentive payments to get doctors to try them...
...insurers would have a strong incentive to sell on the exchange...
...then their staff do not have so much incentive to help you because he's a worker for the government...
...America lacked the incentive to care for the majority of its citizens as it found no rival for its economic model...
...It's always more of an incentive if you're doing it with other people...

phrases.pCn: 经济激励，经济刺激；经济诱因
激励相容；剌激的协调性
奖金，奖励津贴；奖励工资，激励工资

remMethod.val: in ＋ cent(分， 分币) ＋ ive → 用钱(分币)刺激 → 刺激， 鼓励

trans.tranOther: something that encourages you to work harder, start a new activity etc
